importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Doug Martin's death, indicating the timeline of the news event.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, highlighting his career span and peak performance years.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout career at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and scored 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin had 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns during his career.
Martin earned a Pro Bowl berth in 2012 and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers named him one of the top 50 players in franchise history during its 50-year anniversary celebration.
The cause of death is currently unconfirmed, and the family has asked for privacy at this time.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning a Pro Bowl berth in 2012 and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. He also contributed as a receiver with 148 catches for 1,207 yards. After playing six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders, Martin was named one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the team's 50th anniversary celebration. The cause of death remains unconfirmed, and the family has requested privacy.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
